node.html: One framework, mobile and desktop. Develop across all platforms with speed and performance.

The create-react-app command line tool makes it easy to generate a fully configured React project. Don't want to tinker endlessly with build tools and configurations which constantly change and break? Move that responsibility to create-react-app.

frontmatter.label: cra
frontmatter.title: create-react-app
frontmatter.subtitle: Create React apps with no build configuration.

node.html:
Enzyme is a JavaScript Testing utility for React that makes it easier to assert, manipulate, and traverse your React Components' output.

Enzyme's API is meant to be intuitive and flexible by mimicking jQuery's API for DOM manipulation and traversal.
Complete and easy to set-up JavaScript testing solution. Works out of the box for any React project.

frontmatter.label: jest
frontmatter.title: Jest
frontmatter.subtitle: Fast, productive testing courtesy of the React project.

node.html: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine. It forms the basis for modern frontend development, with tools written in JavaScript that perform most of the work for rich frontend app development.

frontmatter.label: nodejs
frontmatter.title: Node.js
frontmatter.subtitle: JavaScript outside of the browser, on the command-line or server-side

node.html: Python has a long history with testing and different testing frameworks. Over the last decade, pytest has become the most popular, mature, and extensible Python testing framework.

node.html: TypeScript starts from the same syntax and semantics that millions of JavaScript developers know today. Use existing JavaScript code, incorporate popular JavaScript libraries, and call TypeScript code from JavaScript.

node.html: React makes it painless to create interactive UIs. Design simple views for each state in your application, and React will efficiently update and render just the right components when your data changes.
